docs.lead_paragraph: The arrival of the Europa at Halifax, and of the Jura at New-York, continue our European intelligence to the last day of the last year. Little of interest had transpired in addition to the advices of the Hungarian, save the sudden death of the greatest of British historical writers, Lord MACAULAY, an event which occurred in London on the 28th ult.

headline.main: The Ashland Association.; THIRTEENTH ANNUAL FESTIVAL.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Ashland Association of the City of NewYork celebrated the thirteenth anniversary of their organization, at the Waverley Hotel, corner of Broadway and Fourth-street, last evening. There were about fifty members of the Association and invited guests present; but though the number was small, ...

headline.main: FROM WASHINGTON.; RUMORED CHANGE IN THE CABINET. Disunion Speech of Mr. Clingman in the Senate. A Dull and Desultory Debate in the House. MR. BIGLER'S BILL IN THE SENATE.

docs.lead_paragraph: Rumor says that a Cabinet officer will probably resign to-morrow or next day. The alleged reason is ill health, or the pressure of private business. The real reason is a difference with the President as to the prospective policy to be pursued by the Administration against Judge DOUGLAS. There has been a breeze in the Cabinet for some time on this point, and ...

docs.snippet: At the meeting of the Board of Councilmen, last evening, the Counsel to the Corporation was directed to report his opinion whether the bills for medicalservices at station-houses, are County or City bills.

docs.snippet: It is with feelings of deep regret that we announce the death of the eminent essayist and historian, Lord MACAULAY, which melancholy event took place at eight o'clock on Wednesday, evening, at the residence of the noble lord, Holly Lodge,...
docs.lead_paragraph: It is with feelings of deep regret that we announce the death of the eminent essayist and historian, Lord MACAULAY, which melancholy event took place at eight o'clock on Wednesday, evening, at the residence of the noble lord, Holly Lodge, CampdenHill, Kensington.

headline.main: Police Reports.; DISINTERESTED FRIENDSHIP. CARRYING A SLUNG SHOT. A COMPLAINANT WANTED. BOGUS BANK BILLS.

docs.lead_paragraph: On Friday night, a countryman named James Burns met James Brennan, a sharper, in the saloon No. 523 Canal-street. Burns entered into conversation with the stranger, for whom he professed much friendship, drank several times to his health and prosperity, and finally invited him to take a stroll and view the City sights. They had not walked far, however, ere the countryman's wallet. containing $36, which

headline.main: THE PEYTON DINNER.; Inception of the National Union Movement. Speeches of Hon. J.J. Crittenden, Baylie Peyton, and others.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Philadelphia Academy of Music, on Saturday evening, presented a brilliant spectacle. The occasion was a National Union dinner to Hon. BAILLIE PEYTON, of Tennessee, by the Republicans of that city. Hon. BAILLIE PEYTON was formerly United States Minister to Chill, and for a number of years past has bees in California.
